result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Sawisky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: that atty Domingo Cruz is relieved as counsel for the deft.
Status conference on July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def has filed a motion to w/draw as counsel for reasons stated on the record.
BTC: Motion to w/draw is granted, new atty to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No violent contact with the victim named in the complaint (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must act immediately to get prescription filled upon release from jail. Take all medications as prescribed. Defendant must have telephone contact with his atty at least once a week.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod for Erika Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on Def's Motion for bond review.
Def is requesting to modify bond to a signature bond.
State does not object.
BTC: Request granted, Modify bond to a $1000 signature bond, all other conditions remain, add condition that Deft must act immediately to get that prescription filled upon release from jail and that the deft must have telephone contact with his atty at least once a week.
Status conference on June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $900.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No violent contact with the victim named in the complaint (person, property, residence or family).   Take all medications as prescribed.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Jacob A Sawisky in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
